definitions: total value of goods and services produced within a country during one year
examples: The country's GDP increased by three percent last quarter
Economic analysts track GDP growth to assess national economic health

definitions: unit measuring one billion cycles per second in electromagnetic frequencies
examples: Modern processors operate at speeds exceeding four GHz
The wireless router broadcasts signals at 2.4 GHz frequency

definitions: mean solar time at the Royal Observatory in Greenwich, London, used as reference
examples: The meeting starts at 3 PM GMT for all participants
International flights display arrival times in both local and GMT

definitions: total value of goods and services produced by a country's residents including foreign earnings
examples: The nation's GNP includes income from overseas investments
Economists compare GNP and GDP to understand international economic activity

definitions: informal name for the Republican Party in United States politics, meaning Grand Old Party
examples: GOP senators voted against the proposed healthcare bill yesterday
The GOP convention nominated their presidential candidate in July

definitions: numerical average of grades earned in courses, typically on a four-point scale
examples: She maintained a 3.8 GPA throughout her college years
Medical schools require applicants to have a minimum GPA

definitions: visual system allowing users to interact with computers through graphical icons and visual indicators
examples: The new GUI makes the software more intuitive to use
Developers designed a cleaner GUI for the mobile application

definitions: triangular portion of wall between edges of intersecting roof pitches
examples: The Victorian house featured decorative gables on all sides
Rain ran down the steep gable toward the gutters

definitions: country located on west coast of Central Africa along the Atlantic Ocean
examples: Gabon exports significant quantities of oil to international markets
The capital of Gabon is Libreville on the coast

definitions: person from Gabon or relating to the country of Gabon
examples: The Gabonese delegation attended the African Union summit
Gabonese cuisine features plantains and cassava as staple ingredients

definitions: archangel in Judaism, Christianity, and Islam who serves as God's messenger
masculine given name derived from the Hebrew meaning God is my strength
examples: Gabriel announced the birth of Jesus to Mary
The angel Gabriel appears in religious texts of three faiths
Gabriel started his new job at the hospital yesterday
My nephew Gabriel celebrates his birthday next week

definitions: group of Celtic languages including Irish, Scottish Gaelic, and Manx
examples: Students learn Gaelic to preserve their cultural heritage
Road signs in Scotland display both English and Gaelic text

definitions: Yuri Gagarin, Soviet cosmonaut who became first human in space in 1961
examples: Gagarin orbited Earth in the Vostok 1 spacecraft
Schools and streets worldwide bear Gagarin's name in his honor

definitions: Greek goddess personifying Earth, mother of all life in mythology
scientific hypothesis viewing Earth as self-regulating living system
examples: Ancient Greeks worshipped Gaia as the primordial Earth mother
Gaia gave birth to the sky and sea in mythology
The Gaia hypothesis suggests Earth maintains conditions suitable for life
Scientists debate whether Gaia theory explains climate regulation

definitions: Arthurian knight known for purity and achievement of the Holy Grail quest
examples: Sir Galahad found the Holy Grail through his spiritual purity
Medieval texts describe Galahad as the perfect knight

definitions: northern region of ancient and modern Israel containing significant religious sites
examples: Jesus performed many miracles in Galilee according to scripture
Tourists visit Galilee to see the Sea of Galilee

definitions: Galileo Galilei, Italian astronomer and physicist who revolutionized scientific observation
examples: Galileo discovered Jupiter's largest moons through his telescope
The Catholic Church condemned Galileo for supporting heliocentrism

definitions: large covered shopping area with shops on multiple levels, often with glass roof
examples: The Galleria features over two hundred stores and restaurants
Shoppers enjoyed natural light streaming through the galleria's skylights

definitions: American analytics company known for public opinion polls and workforce consulting
examples: The latest Gallup poll shows changing voter preferences
Gallup surveys track employee engagement across industries

definitions: smallest country in mainland Africa, located along the Gambia River
examples: The Gambia gained independence from Britain in 1965
Tourists visit Gambia for its beaches and wildlife reserves

definitions: person from The Gambia or relating to the country of Gambia
examples: Gambian musicians blend traditional and modern styles
The Gambian economy relies heavily on tourism and agriculture

definitions: third letter of the Greek alphabet used in mathematics and science
high-energy electromagnetic radiation emitted during radioactive decay
examples: Scientists use gamma to denote the third variable in equations
The gamma symbol appears frequently in physics formulas
Gamma rays can penetrate most materials except dense lead
Doctors use gamma radiation to treat certain cancers

definitions: Mohandas or Mahatma Gandhi, Indian leader who pioneered nonviolent resistance for independence
examples: Gandhi led India's independence movement through peaceful protest
Martin Luther King studied Gandhi's philosophy of nonviolence

definitions: compulsory payment or tax imposed by legal authority
act of collecting or seizing property to satisfy a debt
examples: The city council approved a new levy for school improvements
Property owners must pay the annual levy by December
The IRS issued a levy against his bank account
Creditors can levy assets to recover unpaid debts

definitions: complete set of words and phrases used in a particular language or field
dictionary or reference book containing alphabetical list of words with definitions
examples: Medical students must master the specialized lexicon of anatomy
The poet's lexicon includes both archaic and modern terms
Scholars compiled a comprehensive lexicon of ancient Greek
The technical lexicon helps engineers understand specialized terminology

definitions: legal responsibility for debts or obligations that must be settled
person or thing that causes problems or puts one at disadvantage
examples: The company's liabilities exceeded its assets last quarter
Insurance protects against personal liability in accidents
His poor communication skills became a liability at work
The old equipment is more liability than asset now

definitions: person who establishes and maintains communication between groups or departments
close relationship or cooperation between people or organizations, sometimes romantic
examples: She serves as liaison between marketing and production departments
The military liaison coordinates with civilian authorities
Their liaison lasted several months before becoming public
The liaison between the two companies improved project outcomes

definitions: person who tells lies or deliberately makes false statements
examples: Nobody trusts him anymore because he's a proven liar
The witness was exposed as a liar during cross-examination

definitions: published false statement that damages a person's reputation, constituting a civil wrong
examples: The newspaper faced libel charges for the unverified story
Publishing false accusations online can constitute libel

definitions: person who supports political and social reform promoting individual freedoms
education emphasizing general knowledge and intellectual development over technical training
examples: Liberals advocate for expanded social programs and civil rights
The liberal candidate won in the urban districts
A liberal arts education develops critical thinking skills
Liberal arts colleges focus on humanities and sciences

definitions: removal of government restrictions and regulations in economic or social policy
examples: Economic liberalisation attracted foreign investment to the country
Trade liberalisation reduced tariffs between member nations

definitions: political and social philosophy emphasizing individual rights, democracy, and free market economics
examples: Classical liberalism advocates for limited government intervention
Modern liberalism supports both individual freedom and social justice

definitions: process of removing government restrictions and controls from economic or social activities
examples: Market liberalization led to increased competition among providers
Financial liberalization allowed banks to offer new services

definitions: act of setting someone free from imprisonment, slavery, or oppression
examples: The liberation of the city came after months of resistance
Women's liberation movements fought for equal rights worldwide

definitions: person who frees others from captivity, oppression, or foreign control
examples: Simon Bolivar is known as the liberator of South America
The soldiers saw themselves as liberators, not conquerors

definitions: person advocating minimal government intervention in personal and economic affairs
examples: Libertarians oppose both economic regulations and social restrictions
The libertarian candidate emphasized individual freedom and responsibility

definitions: political philosophy advocating maximum individual liberty and minimal government intervention
examples: Libertarianism emphasizes personal responsibility over government assistance
Economic libertarianism opposes most forms of market regulation

definitions: state of being free from oppressive restrictions on behavior or expression
permission to do something that would otherwise be restricted
examples: The constitution guarantees liberty and justice for all citizens
Patrick Henry declared 'Give me liberty or give me death'
Sailors were given liberty to go ashore for the weekend
I took the liberty of ordering lunch for everyone

definitions: person's overall sexual drive or desire for sexual activity
examples: Stress and fatigue can significantly reduce a person's libido
Certain medications may affect libido as a side effect

definitions: person trained in library science who manages and provides access to information resources
examples: The librarian helped students find sources for their research papers
School librarians teach information literacy alongside managing collections

definitions: building or room containing collections of books and other materials for reading or reference
organized collection of resources, data, or programmed functions in computing
examples: Students studied for exams in the university library
The public library offers free internet access to residents
Developers imported the graphics library into their project
The software library contains thousands of reusable functions

definitions: text of an opera or other extended musical vocal work
examples: The composer collaborated with a poet to write the libretto
Students studied the Italian libretto alongside the musical score

definitions: official document giving permission to own, use, or do something legally
examples: Drivers must carry their licence whenever operating a vehicle
The restaurant's liquor licence expires at the end of the month

definitions: legal permission granted by authorities to do something otherwise prohibited
formal permission to use intellectual property or operate professionally
examples: You need a license to practice medicine in this state
The city issues business licenses to legitimate operators
Software companies sell licenses for their products
The patent license allows manufacturing of the invention

definitions: person or organization holding a license to use property or conduct activities
examples: The licensee must comply with all terms of the agreement
Bar licensees face fines for serving minors

definitions: complex organism formed by symbiotic relationship between fungi and algae or bacteria
examples: Lichen grows slowly on rocks and tree bark
Scientists use lichen as indicators of air quality

definitions: single movement of the tongue over something
very small amount or quick application of something
examples: The dog gave her face an affectionate lick
One lick of the ice cream convinced him to buy it
The fence needs a lick of paint before winter
We don't have a lick of evidence against him

definitions: action of passing the tongue over something repeatedly
severe defeat or beating in competition or conflict
examples: The cat's constant licking keeps its fur clean
Excessive licking might indicate anxiety in dogs
Our team took a real licking in yesterday's game
The company took a licking in the stock market

definitions: plant root used as flavoring in candy and medicine, with distinctive sweet taste
examples: Black licorice candy has a strong, distinctive flavor
Traditional medicine uses licorice root for digestive issues

definitions: removable or hinged cover for the top of a container
movable fold of skin that covers and protects the eye
examples: She twisted the lid off the pickle jar
The pot lid rattled as the water boiled
Her lids grew heavy as sleep approached
The doctor examined the swollen lid carefully
